item.name: Bytes Received/sec
item.description: Rate of total bytes transferred by service (received)

item.name: Bytes Sent/sec
item.description: Rate of total bytes transferred by service (sent)

item.name: Bytes Total/sec
item.description: Rate of total bytes transferred by service (sum of bytes sent and received)

item.name: Connection attempts/sec
item.description: The rate that connections to the Web service are attempted.

item.name: Current Connections
item.description: number of current connections to the Web service. This counter’s interpretation depends upon many variables, such as the type of requests (ISAPI, CGI, static HTML, etc.), CPU utilization, et cetera. So you’d need to do some investigation to triage any underlying issues.

item.name: Get Requests/sec
item.description: Total number of HTTP GET requests received by WWW service

item.name: Post Requests/sec
item.description: Number of HTTP requests using POST method

item.name: Service Uptime
item.description: Uptime for WWW service

item.name: Current Files Cached
item.description: Current number of files whose content is in the user-mode cache

item.name: Current Metadata Cached
item.description: Current number of metadata information blocks currently in the user-mode cache.

item.name: Current URIs Cached
item.description: URI information blocks currently in the user-mode cache

item.name: File Cache Flushes
item.description: The number of files removed from the user-mode cache since service startup

item.name: File Cache Hits
item.description: Total number of successful lookups in the user-mode file cache since service startup. The preferred value depends on content. For example, for static content, the value should be high.

item.name: File Cache Hits %
item.description: The ratio of user-mode file cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup). Note: This value might be low if the Kernel URI cache hits percentage is high.

item.name: File Cache Misses
item.description: Total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode file cache since service startup.

item.name: Metadata Cache Hits
item.description: The ratio of user-mode metadata cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: URI Cache Flushes
item.description: Counts the number of URI cache flushes that have occurred since the service startup. Files are flushed if a response is taking longer than specified in the threshold or if a file was edited or modified.

item.name: URI Cache Hits
item.description: Counts the number of successful lookups in the URI cache since the service startup. A low value for this counter is a strong indication that requests are not finding cached responses.

item.name: URI Cache Hits %
item.description: The ratio of user-mode URI Cache Hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: URI Cache Misses
item.description: Total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode URI cache since service startup. You might want to investigate for issues if this value is high, in combination with a low URI Cache Hits value.

item.name: World Side Web Publishing Service
item.description: World Wide Web Publishing Service

resource.name: IIS - File Cache Hits and URI Cache %

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft IIS:perf_counter["\Web Service(_Total)\Service Uptime"].last()}>0 and {Template Microsoft IIS:perf_counter["\Web Service(_Total)\Service Uptime"].last()}<600
trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] IIS was Restarted

graph.name: IIS - File Cache Hits and URI Cache %
